title: 109_hr2051
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005" provides appropriate coverage of immunosuppressive drugs under the Medicare program for organ transplant recipients. The Act "Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005" ensures continued entitlement to immunosuppressive drugs for transplant recipients under the Medicare program. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act to extend coverage for these drugs. The Act "Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005" extends coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant recipients under Medicare. Individuals only eligible for immunosuppressive drug coverage must enroll under this part and pay the full premium to receive such coverage. The Act extends Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant recipients. Beneficiaries entitled to coverage must pay applicable deductible and coinsurance. Procedures will be established to identify and distinguish eligible beneficiaries. The Act extends Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant recipients, with procedures to distinguish eligible beneficiaries. Additionally, a technical amendment is made to the Social Security Act. The Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005 extends Medicare coverage for immunosuppressive drugs without time limitations. The amendments apply to drugs provided after the Act's enactment date. SEC. 3. PLANS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS. This section amends the Public Health Service Act to include coverage of immunosuppressive drugs under certain health insurance plans. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs equal to pre-enactment levels. Amendments are made to the Public Health Service Act to ensure compliance with the new requirements. Amendment to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 requires coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant patients. SEC. 714. COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Transplant Patients Act of 2005 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs that is as comprehensive as before the enactment date. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to incorporate this requirement. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant patients. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for transplant patients under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include comprehensive coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for transplant patients under group health plans, effective from January 1, 2006.
